item.title: Documentation
item.description: I would vote for two very different documentation tools for a data science project, sphinx docs, and squidfunk/mkdocs-material. Sphinx docs Sphinx docs is a mature and stable. I love reStructuredText as the syntax as it is very versatile. It supports math, figures with captions, admonitions, cross reference, auto doc from docstrings, cross project cross referencing, pdf generation, etc. reStructuredText is not the only choice We can also use markdown by choosing the markdown parser. squidfunk/mkdocs-material squidfunk’s mkdocs-material is a rather light-weight but is also growing to be versatile now. The engine is mkdocs. mkdocs-material is a theme but provides a lot of useful and easy to use elements.
